alert.note: Alert for Benton; Jackson; Jones; Linn (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Excessive Heat Watch issued August 20 at 8:06PM CDT until August 23 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... ...HEAT ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with heat index values up to 115. * WHERE...In Iowa, Benton, Linn, Jones and Jackson Counties. In Illinois, Carroll County. * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, until 8 PM CDT this evening. For the Excessive Heat Watch, from 8 PM CDT this evening through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Be prepared to drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air- conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.
